location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Copy of letter No 1642/450 of 1872 from Colonel Lewis Pelly, HBM's Political Resident in the Persian Gulf, on board British India Steam Navigation Company's Steam Ship India, to The Secretary to Government, Political Department, Bombay

mods.abstract: Letter enclosing copies of the letters which Pelly had addressd to Commander Keats of H M's Ship Lynx;Lieutenant-Colonel Edward Charles Ross, Political Agent at Muscat; and the Commander of the Marine Gunboat Hugh Roserelaying instructions for the maintenance of the maritime peace in the Gulf during his absence in Kurrachee [Karachi].The letter goes on to report that his Second Assistant Resident, Captain Charles Grant, will be at Bahrain and his uncovenanted Assistant, James Charles Edwards will handle local affairs at Bushire.
